reviews.review:
I am a big fan of Left 4 Dead, it is a super fast-paced zombie shooter with some of the best shooting mechanics I have seen in game. It is super accessible with a perfect learning curve. You will feel like you're gradually progressing more and more as you play. The teamwork aspect of it is very well designed and it ensures an intense experience every time you play with your friends. One of my friends actually took the time to draw this huge poster of a particular event that happened in the game for my burfday. It was basically me healing three people while fending off zombies, one of my best memories in my time as a gamer. 

Oh yeah, and Killing Floor? Not a huge fan, really.
Buen juego, es muy cooperativo y me gusta mucho.

Je joue plus du tout au 1, mais c etais 18 heure de bonheur 

NOTE 7/10

ultimate game

One of the most satisfying, visceral games I've ever played. 

With a steep learning curve don't be afraid to start off on the lowest difficulties initially to learn how the game flows, but given time you will be dancing through waves of grotesque enemies delivering swift retribution in a ballet of destruction. 

Worth every penny, I've been playing this for years and think I'll be playing it for many more.

Killing Floor may be old, but it is still gold! What more could you ask from a game nowadays, 6 player Co-Op FPS Survival experience at it's peak with so many weapons and maps to play whether from Tripwire themselves or even from the community in the workshop. There is plenty to be had from this game.

The only real downside is compared to Killing Floor 2 it is a long grind to level up a perk to Level 6. Will not judge anyone else to use a level up perk map to just help with that to fully enjoy this game.
Yes.

Une tuerie c'est le cas de le dire !
De l'adr√©naline √† 200%, c'est sombre, c'est Hard et les t√™tes explosent dans tous les sens.

Killing floor √† pour moi tr√®s peu de d√©fauts.C'est l'un des meilleurs fps coop auquel j'ai pu jouer.Il demande du skill contrairement √† beaucoup de fps coop actuels beaucoup trop facile pour gratifier le noob.

L√† vous allez devoir vous y filer.

C'est √† dire monter de difficult√©s au fur et √† mesure pour conna√Ætre les maps et les tips avant d'avoir le skill et le level
suffisant pour pourvoir jouer en HOE (difficult√©e maximale).

Certes il est dur mais entre amis ce jeu devient beaucoup plus facile comme beaucoup de fps coop, ensuite avec des randoms en HOE c'est cors√© c'est vrai mais si vous tombez sur de bons joueurs vous pouvez win de temps en temps quand m√™me ^^.

Les plus:

-Tout est parfaitement √©quilibr√© perks,armes,maps (d'ailleurs pas mal sont le fruit de modders talentueux et sont devenu par la suite des maps officielles), c'est assez bluffant.

-Le ressenti des armes est excellent ainsi que le son.

-Le jeu n'est pas lourd et super bien optimis√©, perso je crash pratiquement jamais.

-Serveur d√©di√© aussi donc aucun lag.

Les moins:

-Les serveurs √† plus de 6 joueurs bourr√©s de mods et maps toujours plus bidons.

-le fait que l'on puisse join une game dans les waves finale souvent √ßa se finit par un fail pour peu que ce soit un noob c'est mort car le jeu s'adapte aux nombres de joueurs, un point fort pourtant mais qui a son vice.

-Les teams Full berserker qui font du kiting

-Pas de spacialisation sonore (√ßa vient peut √™tre de mon casque) mais c'est le seul jeu ou je n'en ai pas s√ªrement car il est un peu vieux.

Mon seul gros regret sur ce jeu et qu'il n'est pas pouss√© le mode objectif plus loin avec plus de maps car il est vraiment excellent.

Que dire de plus √† part de l'acheter sans h√©siter si vous aimez les fps coop c'est un must have
Enjoy

Great game for any fans of zombie FPS games. 09/10!

Ups:
+ Nice variety of perks (classes)
+ And weapons
+ Good amount of weapon combos and playstyles possible
+ Variety of enemies
+ Several "hit combos" to master, allowing quick kills on powerful foes
+ Buttload of maps
+ Buttload of achieves to get
+ Aiming both with hip shot and aim down has an unique feel, gets a bit of pratice to get used to but works great
+ You can do damage to yourself with granades and explosions, but not on allies (on normal servers anw).

Downs:
- Movement is a bit clunky
- Movement doesnt have any kind of dash or sprint, and most importantly, feels slow AF (for some classes)
- Most weapons lock your caracter in the reload animation instead of allowing you to switch weapons and "lose" the reload, geting you killed more than a few times. This one is pretty shitty IMO
- In a few maps there is a chance that the final boss stage Trader is so far away from initial spawn that any person that died the previous round will have to fight naked, therefore more hurting than helping the team
- Geting hitted, no matter if by the most powerful mob or the liltle ones, makes a nasty screen shake that is not fun (at all). But then again, you shouldnt let them close anyway lol
- The "hit combos", altho fun and really useful, they can also be quite anoying since you will get to a point where you "must" master and do them to play decently, instead of them being a "bonus" kinda thing

All things considered, this is one hell of a good game, recommended in a heart beat.

[h1]Killing Floor est un tr√®s bon jeu de survie apocalyptique avec une riche communaut√© qui saura vous proposer un nombre cons√©quent de serveurs customis√©s, mais aussi pour vous √©pauler dans les serveurs officiels.[/h1]

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=924025321

[b] L'un des atouts de Killing Floor, c'est bien sa trame musical qui est pr√©sente au moment ou les monstres arrivent, cela vient aux oreilles comme un m√©lange de hard-rock et √©lectro qui est tr√®s motivant et ne d√©concentre pas, tout au contraire ces musiques nous font d√©sirer que le vague ne s'arr√™te jamais. Les monstres ne sont pas r√©ellement des zombies mais plut√¥t des clones d'hommes ayant mut√©s suite √† des exp√©riences d√©sastreuses, ce ne sont pas des zombies mais ils en ont les agissements.[/b]

Le grand b√©mol de Killing Floor est un point qui je pense n'a √©chapp√© √† aucun francophone : sa VF, qui est particuli√®rement immonde, √† un point que √ßa en est particuli√®rement dr√¥le. Voyez donc ce lien et vous comprendrez que je ne rigole pas.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPLEDJtupW8

Pas de panique il y'a une solution cependant ! Il vous suffira juste depuis les param√®tres Steam d'activer la version anglaise ( c'est incontournable si vous ne voulez pas √™tre d√©gout√© du jeu ). En d√©pit de cette VF immonde qui est presque imbattable, je vous conseille fortement ce jeu qui est assez fun si vous √™tes plusieurs. IL y'a lors des parties des bullet-time qui sont magnifiques et m√™me jouissifs.
rolha

This was one of the first games I have ever bought on Steam, and I'm still playing it 'till this day. If that is any incentive to get this game (even though a lot of the multiplayer servers are un-used in 'straya), then buy it asap! [Or just wait until it goes on sale]

Pros:
- Unreal Engine 2 can run on almost any PC
- Still fun alone, or with up to *32 others
- A huge modding and map-making community
- DLC that doesn't NEED to be bought to experience all of KF (just cosmetics)
- Almost everyone in the community is nice
- Loads 'o money!!
- Dosh can be thrown after a win
- KF Objectives (ie quests and such)
- Lots of gore
- Still holds up surprisingly well graphically speaking (is that a testiment to this games' awesomeness or how shit games are now???)
- Voice-overs are top-notch (and so are the one-liners)
- THE SOUNDTRACK!!
- A decent selection of classes that are all important to a match in some way
- The sheer variety of maps
- The perk system rewards long-time players, and is tailored to how you play
- A difficulty mode for everyone!
- Those random guys that come onto the voice-chat after smoking a bong or some shit like that

Cons:
- Some may find the perk system "too difficult" to gain exp for
- Lack of players (probably all in KF2 or something)
- It is an old game, but it's almost like revisiting something like Doom
- Non-sale price is a... bit too much this far in its life cycle (but that's Valve for you ;D )
- Ultrawide support via in-game settings is non-existant (have to edit the .ini file) due to its age
- Perks max-out at level 6 (a DLC would have been nice for this)

Please get this game if you haven't already. The more players the better. Also, don't forget to support your favourite servers, and all the modders out there!

* on modded servers

Shooting zeds and splashing dosh with friends, a wonderful game based on the unreal 2004 engine.

Zombie survival FPS, that still rocks our LAN-party group, even the sequel is out and all. In the longer run slightly monotonic and already bit aged grinding, but entertaining and sure as hell challenging nevertheless. Class dynamics in team composition make great variation and really lights the gameplay up. Lot of maps and community content to add spice. Soundtrack is metal as fuck and game has overall killer mood. A Classic.

Only rec if it's $5

All those games are better graphics. less glitchy and just overall more fun even alone.

KF1 is recommended only if you have old PC and cant run KF2 smoothly.
